6.9.21  1:22 pm   hi bill, i was inspired by your lyric "i want to take a walk with you in the hills of france" to buy a cottage in southern France. we found an amazingly priced cottage with 3 separate houses on the property. we all are going to split the price (6 of my friends) do you think it is a good idea?

      as long as you are aware that i had very little knowledge of any hills in france at the time i wrote that. i can update now by saying that i think the hills of france may be in corsica

6.9.21  1:06 pm   hi bill can you give me two tips for mixing music (apart from don't use reverb on bass)

      first, listen to it and see if it's good. if it's already good, then seriously don't do anything. and the second tip is to try to write a song so good that it literally doesn't matter how it's mixed

6.9.21  12:45 pm   How do I get out of bed faster in the morning? Usually it takes me ~20-30 minutes from when I wake up to when I 'start' the day, but I feel this is a tremendous waste of time.

      sleep has gradual faded edges. as long as we're going down this road, you might as well ask if sleep itself is a waste of time. and i guess that all depends whether you have the sleepless update

      in the graphics department, it is likely that you will continue to see me going backward and forward at the same time

6.9.21  5:32 am   do you know indonesia?

      yes

6.9.21  5:32 am   Hi Bill, I am trying to create lyrics for my songs, but I cant create meaningful lyrics, can you please tell me how to create deep meaning lyrics? 

      basically you have to bring what you are saying into alignment with what you mean. it's kind of like aiming a telescope. you have to spend some time rotating it around for a while, and eventually you will get it lined up right. just be patient and allow yourself to say 'anything' for a while, and then over time you will gradually hone closer and closer into that alignment where you actually say and mean the same thing at the same time

6.9.21  5:22 am   im best friends with my own front door activates this part of my brain i can never reach. it's amazing. it's the bent key that somehow unlocks the safe to gold and crack. specifically talking about 1:40 to the end, all the lines connect together so perfectlyHOW WAS THIS MASTERPIECE MADE. i want the full backstory. maybe some lines from the timestamp i said would do..

      this is exactly what happened. all my life i've struggled with the reality that it takes me much much much longer than i wish it takes, to produce anything. years go by and i'm fighting to reach a reasonable pace, and never seem to succeed. well, one day i suddenly snapped, took a desperate walk outside, got angry and screamed at the sky a little (in my mind), and just said '2 weeks or die trying'. the thing is, i'm sure i've tried saying this before, but sometimes the stars align and it works. so the first part of doing any song is song selection. i go through my list of songs, which have a writing % completion of anywhere from .1% to 100%. and i have to choose one. this is normally almost impossible for me, and to do it right, i have to spend many days on it. i went through maybe 50% of the list, and it felt like none of them were really working for me at the time, and i felt a bit pressured to do it quickly (because of the 2 week challenge i was doing), and so in a snap decision, i said 'what song do i WISH i was doing', and i was able to trick myself into imagining the first line. so that was cool, felt like i was off to a roaring start, and then suddenly a day went by and i hadn't made it out of the 'box' of that melody/chord sequence. in other words, i had maybe the first 6 lines, which, as you can hear, are all within the same exact musical figure. but what scared me most was that i had spent way too long and only come up with a few seconds. and i knew this was no way to beat the 2 week challenge. so essentially i realized that i had to finish the writing in 4 hours. so basically a ruthless burst of paranoid speed had to kick in. you can probably hear the brute force, desperation, and then attempts to deal with it, in the 'bad sign' part, and 'not gonna happen' part. basically i've hurled myself off the edge, into whatever comes next, before having earthly idea what would actually come next. so in that sense i was almost improvising (in the writing). To be clear, i'm talking about the writing, which is done entirely before the recording. so i'm not saying i improvised the song during recording. i always write the song first. but during the writing process it felt a bit like improvising because i had to write it so fast. So the next few sections sort of have their ups and downs, for better or for worse, because at this point i've convinced myself that there's no turning back, i have to just run, because there's no time. And inevitably, if you are able to truly adopt this attitude, it eventually finds its feet. and that seems to happen when it lands on the outvamp, and these last 16 bars seem to be an outpouring of the exact emotions i was dealing with, in the circumstances of the 2 week challenge and all the desperation leading up to it, and how i was dealing with it

6.9.21  5:01 am   do u ever get jealous of people

      yes

      yes

6.9.21  4:09 am   do you like shopping on wednesdays?

      it's ok, but i think tuesday is better, and a non-holiday monday is best

6.9.21  2:33 am   I understand that the best way to improve is to practice (at making music, and also other things). but did you ever feel the urge to be perfect at something right away? if you did, do you have tips on overcoming it?

     what usually happens is, you'll go through a back and forth 'good news bad news' scenario. the bad news is "fuck, i can't do this right now". the good news is "i'll be able to do it in the future." the whole trick is to find ways you can enjoy it now. think outside the box and find ways to enjoy it even when you suck. because the first 2 rules of science are: "you get good at something if you do it a lot" and "if you enjoy something then you'll do it a lot"

     will I always be better at things if I dedicate more time to them?

      usually

6.9.21  2:26 am   Bill, why is it all so hard and confusing

      so you don't get bored

      tom hanks got most of them

6.8.21  3:49 am   Hey Bill, I need some help. I'm really looking to improve my piano skills (I'm a beginner) but I'm not sure what to focus on. Chords? Melodies? Learning songs? What do you reckon?

     follow your innermost desires

     i seem to remember playing C and E notes at the same time. then playing D and F notes at the same time. and so on. and soaking in the vibes
